### Two Jack Lakeside Campground Site Investigation – Banff National Park

#### Tender Information

* Tender Reference Number: cb-8235-59232956
* Solicitation Number: 5P648-23-0149/A
* Tender Closing Date: September 19, 2023, 16:00 EST
* Expected Contract Start Date: October 2, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2024

#### Description

Parks Canada Agency is soliciting proposals for the Two Jack Lakeside Campground Site Investigation in Banff National Park. The successful contractor will conduct a site survey investigation to support detailed design work for upgrades to the campground's sanitary, electrical, and potable water infrastructure.

#### Requirements and Specifications

The project aims to maintain current visitor services while achieving environmental gains and operational efficiencies. The survey investigation will allow Parks Canada Agency to initiate detailed utility upgrade design work, encompassing electrical, sanitary, potable water, and site restoration and rehabilitation scopes. Please note that detailed design will be contracted separately.

#### Bidders' Conference and Enquiries

A bidders' conference will be held via teleconference on August 29, 2023, at 10:00 MDT. Bidders are encouraged to participate and raise questions. Enquiries regarding this solicitation must be submitted in writing and received no later than five business days prior to the tender closing date.

#### Notice of Amendment

The tender has been amended five times; the latest amendment date is September 19, 2023. Bidders should ensure they have the most up-to-date documentation to prevent any processing issues with their submission.

#### Important Information

* Bids received by fax and email will be accepted as official.
* Parks Canada Agency is not currently accepting bids via SAP Ariba; bidders must submit their bids via fax or email as indicated in the solicitation document.
* Only the email address soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca is accepted for responses to the bid solicitation.
* The maximum email file size that Parks Canada is capable of receiving is 15 megabytes.

#### Evaluation Criteria

The evaluation will consider the combined rating of technical merit and price. Bidders should refer to the solicitation document for full evaluation criteria details.  Following evaluation, three (3) resumes of short-listed Bidders will be requested and conducted interviews will be performed, in assessing Bidders’ understanding of this scope of work.
